data.title: Sunset Blvd. (1950)
data.summary: A screenwriter is hired to rework a faded silent film star's script, only to find himself developing a dangerous relationship.

data.title: Double Indemnity (1944)
data.summary: An insurance representative lets himself be talked into a murder/insurance fraud scheme that arouses the suspicion of an insurance investigator.

data.title: The Third Man (1949)
data.summary: Pulp novelist Holly Martins travels to shadowy, postwar Vienna, only to find himself investigating the mysterious death of an old friend, Harry Lime.

data.title: White Heat (1949)
data.summary: A psychopathic criminal with a mother complex makes a daring break from prison and leads his old gang in a chemical plant payroll heist. Shortly after the plan takes place, events take a crazy turn.

data.title: Ace in the Hole (1951)
data.summary: A frustrated former big-city journalist now stuck working for an Albuquerque newspaper exploits a story about a man trapped in a cave to re-jump start his career, but the situation quickly escalates into an out-of-control circus.

data.title: Sweet Smell of Success (1957)
data.summary: Powerful but unethical Broadway columnist J.J. Hunsecker coerces unscrupulous press agent Sidney Falco into breaking up his sister's romance with a jazz musician.

data.title: Touch of Evil (1958)
data.summary: A stark, perverse story of murder, kidnapping, and police corruption in a Mexican border town.

data.title: The Maltese Falcon (1941)
data.summary: A private detective takes on a case that involves him with three eccentric criminals, a gorgeous liar, and their quest for a priceless statuette.

data.title: Out of the Past (1947)
data.summary: A private eye escapes his past to run a gas station in a small town, but his past catches up with him. Now he must return to the big city world of danger, corruption, double crosses and duplicitous dames.

data.title: Laura (1944)
data.summary: A police detective falls in love with the woman whose murder he is investigating.

data.title: The Big Heat (1953)
data.summary: Tough cop Dave Bannion takes on a politically powerful crime syndicate.

data.title: The Big Sleep (1946)
data.summary: Private detective Philip Marlowe is hired by a rich family. Before the complex case is over, he's seen murder, blackmail, and what might be love.

data.title: The Night of the Hunter (1955)
data.summary: A religious fanatic marries a gullible widow whose young children are reluctant to tell him where their real daddy hid $10,000 he'd stolen in a robbery.

data.title: Notorious (1946)
data.summary: A woman is asked to spy on a group of Nazi friends in South America. How far will she have to go to ingratiate herself with them?

data.title: Strangers on a Train (1951)
data.summary: A psychotic socialite attempts to force a professional tennis star to prove a theory that two complete strangers can get away with murder.

data.title: The Killing (1956)
data.summary: Crooks plan and execute a daring race-track robbery.

data.title: Mildred Pierce (1945)
data.summary: A hard-working mother inches towards disaster as she divorces her husband and starts a successful restaurant business to support her spoiled daughter.

data.title: In a Lonely Place (1950)
data.summary: A potentially violent screenwriter is a murder suspect until his lovely neighbor clears him. But she begins to have doubts.

data.title: The Lost Weekend (1945)
data.summary: The desperate life of a chronic alcoholic is followed through a four-day drinking bout.

data.title: Angels with Dirty Faces (1938)
data.summary: A priest tries to stop a gangster from corrupting a group of street kids.

data.title: Night and the City (1950)
data.summary: A small-time grifter and nightclub tout takes advantage of some fortuitous circumstances and tries to become a big-time player as a wrestling promoter.

data.title: Key Largo (1948)
data.summary: A man visits his old friend's hotel and finds a gangster running things. As a hurricane approaches, the two end up confronting each other.

data.title: The Asphalt Jungle (1950)
data.summary: A major heist goes off as planned, until bad luck and double crosses cause everything to unravel.

data.title: Scarlet Street (1945)
data.summary: When a man in mid-life crisis befriends a young woman, her venal fiancé persuades her to con him out of the fortune they mistakenly assume he possesses.

data.title: The Roaring Twenties (1939)
data.summary: Three men attempt to make a living in Prohibitionist America after returning home from fighting together in World War I.

data.title: Scarface (1932)
data.summary: An ambitious and nearly insane violent gangster climbs the ladder of success in the mob, but his weaknesses prove to be his downfall.

data.title: Nightmare Alley (1947)
data.summary: The rise and fall of Stanton Carlisle, a mentalist whose lies and deceit prove to be his downfall.

data.title: The Killers (1946)
data.summary: Hit men kill an unresisting victim, and investigator Reardon uncovers his past involvement with beautiful, deadly Kitty Collins.

data.title: The Woman in the Window (1944)
data.summary: When a conservative middle-aged professor engages in a minor dalliance with a femme fatale, he is plunged into a nightmarish quicksand of blackmail and murder.

data.title: Odd Man Out (1947)
data.summary: A wounded Irish nationalist leader attempts to evade police following a failed robbery in Belfast.

data.title: Gilda (1946)
data.summary: A small-time gambler hired to work in a Buenos Aires casino learns that his ex-lover is married to his employer.

data.title: The Lady from Shanghai (1947)
data.summary: Fascinated by gorgeous Mrs. Bannister, seaman Michael O'Hara joins a bizarre yachting cruise, and ends up mired in a complex murder plot.

data.title: Kiss Me Deadly (1955)
data.summary: A doomed female hitchhiker pulls Mike Hammer into a deadly whirlpool of intrigue, revolving around a mysterious "great whatsit".

data.title: Leave Her to Heaven (1945)
data.summary: A writer falls in love with a young socialite and they are married soon after, but her obsessive love for him threatens to be the undoing of both them and everyone else around them.

data.title: Gun Crazy (1950)
data.summary: A well meaning crack shot husband is pressured by his beautiful marksman wife to go on an interstate robbery spree, where he finds out just how depraved and deadly she really is.

data.title: Caged (1950)
data.summary: A naive nineteen year old widow becomes coarsened and cynical when she is sent to a woman's prison and is exposed to hardened criminals and sadistic guards.

data.title: Brute Force (1947)
data.summary: At a tough penitentiary, prisoner Joe Collins plans to rebel against Captain Munsey, the power-mad chief guard.

data.title: The Letter (1940)
data.summary: The wife of a rubber plantation administrator shoots a man to death and claims it was self-defense, but a letter in her own hand may prove her undoing.

data.title: Dark Passage (1947)
data.summary: A man convicted of murdering his wife escapes from prison and works with a woman to try and prove his innocence.

data.title: Sudden Fear (1952)
data.summary: After an ambitious actor insinuates himself into the life of a wealthy middle-aged playwright and marries her, he plots with his mistress to murder her.

data.title: Spellbound (1945)
data.summary: A psychiatrist protects the identity of an amnesia patient accused of murder while attempting to recover his memory.

data.title: Where the Sidewalk Ends (1950)
data.summary: Det. Sgt. Mark Dixon wants to be something his old man wasn't: a guy on the right side of the law. But Dixon's vicious nature will get the better of him.

data.title: The Harder They Fall (1956)
data.summary: Down-on-his-luck ex-sportswriter Eddie Willis is hired by shady fight promoter Nick Benko to promote his latest find, an unknown but easily exploitable phenom from Argentina.

data.title: The Naked City (1948)
data.summary: Two New York City detectives investigate the death of an attractive young woman. The apparent suicide turns out to be murder.

data.title: Murder, My Sweet (1944)
data.summary: After being hired to find an ex-con's former girlfriend, Philip Marlowe is drawn into a deeply complex web of mystery and deceit.

data.title: Detective Story (1951)
data.summary: On one day in the 21st Precinct squad room, assorted characters form a backdrop for the troubles of hard-nosed Detective Jim McLeod.

data.title: Criss Cross (1949)
data.summary: An armored truck driver and his lovely ex-wife conspire with a gang to have his own truck robbed on the route.

data.title: High Sierra (1941)
data.summary: After being released from prison, notorious thief Roy Earle is hired by his old boss to help a group of inexperienced criminals plan and carry out the robbery of a California resort.

data.title: The Desperate Hours (1955)
data.summary: Three escaped convicts move in on and terrorize a suburban household.

data.title: The Petrified Forest (1936)
data.summary: A waitress, a hobo and a bank robber get mixed up at a lonely diner in the desert.

data.title: The Postman Always Rings Twice (1946)
data.summary: A married woman and a drifter fall in love, then plot to murder her husband. Once the deed is done, they must live with the consequences of their actions.

data.title: The Wrong Man (1956)
data.summary: In 1953, an innocent man named Christopher Emmanuel "Manny" Balestrero is arrested after being mistaken for an armed robber.

data.title: The Strange Love of Martha Ivers (1946)
data.summary: A man is reunited with his childhood friend and her husband, who believe he knows the truth about the death of her rich aunt years earlier.

data.title: The Man with the Golden Arm (1955)
data.summary: A strung-out junkie deals with a demoralizing drug addiction while his crippled wife and card sharks pull him down.

data.title: This Gun for Hire (1942)
data.summary: When assassin Philip Raven shoots a blackmailer and his beautiful female companion dead, he is paid off in marked bills by his treasonous employer who is working with foreign spies.

data.title: No Way Out (1950)
data.summary: A black doctor is assigned to treat two white racist suspects who are brothers, and when one dies, it causes tension that could start a race riot.

data.title: All the King's Men (1949)
data.summary: The rise and fall of a corrupt politician, who makes his friends richer and retains power by dint of a populist appeal.

data.title: Sorry, Wrong Number (1948)
data.summary: While on the telephone, an invalid woman overhears what she thinks is a murder plot and attempts to prevent it.

data.title: I Want to Live! (1958)
data.summary: A prostitute, sentenced to death for murder, pleads her innocence.

data.title: Too Late for Tears (1949)
data.summary: Through a fluke circumstance a ruthless woman stumbles across a suitcase filled with $60,000, and she is determined to hold onto it even if it means murder.

data.title: The Stranger (1946)
data.summary: An investigator from the War Crimes Commission travels to Connecticut to find an infamous Nazi.

data.title: D.O.A. (1949)
data.summary: Frank Bigelow, told he's been poisoned and has only a few days to live, tries to find out who killed him and why.

data.title: The Big Combo (1955)
data.summary: A police lt. is ordered to stop investigating deadly crime boss Mr. Brown, because he hasn't been able to get any hard evidence against him. He then goes after Brown's girlfriend who despises him, for information instead.

data.title: Dead End (1937)
data.summary: The lives of a young man and woman, an infamous gangster and a group of street kids converge one day in a volatile New York City slum.

data.title: Crossfire (1947)
data.summary: A man is murdered, apparently by one of a group of demobilized soldiers he met in a bar. But which one? And why?

data.title: Detour (1945)
data.summary: Chance events trap hitch-hiker Al Roberts in a tightening net of film noir trouble.

data.title: Angel Face (1953)
data.summary: Ambulance driver Frank Jessup is ensnared in the schemes of the sensuous but dangerous Diane Tremayne.

data.title: Pitfall (1948)
data.summary: Married insurance adjuster John Forbes falls for femme fatale Mona Stevens while her boyfriend is in jail and all suffer serious consequences as a result.

data.title: The Locket (1946)
data.summary: Just before a wedding, the bridegroom hears a complex tale painting his lovely bride as devilish and unbalanced.

data.title: Dead Reckoning (1947)
data.summary: A soldier runs away rather than receive the Medal of Honor, so his buddy gets permission to investigate, and love and death soon follow.

data.title: Fallen Angel (1945)
data.summary: A slick con man arrives in a small town looking to make some money, but soon gets more than he bargained for.

data.title: The Blue Dahlia (1946)
data.summary: An ex-bomber pilot is suspected of murdering his unfaithful wife.

data.title: Ministry of Fear (1944)
data.summary: Stephen Neale has just been released from an asylum during World War 2 in England when he stumbles on a deadly Nazi spy plot by accident, and tries to stop it.

data.title: The Mask of Dimitrios (1944)
data.summary: Mystery writer Cornelius Leyden becomes intrigued when the murdered body of a vicious career criminal washes up in the Bosphorus.

data.title: The Verdict (1946)
data.summary: After an innocent man is executed in a case he was responsible for, a Scotland Yard superintendent finds himself investigating the murder of his key witness.

data.title: Deadline - U.S.A. (1952)
data.summary: With his newspaper about to be sold, crusading editor Ed Hutcheson tries to complete an exposé on gangster Rienzi.

data.title: Possessed (1947)
data.summary: After being found wandering the streets of Los Angeles, a severely catatonic woman tells a doctor the complex story of how she wound up there.

data.title: He Walked by Night (1948)
data.summary: This film-noir piece, told in semi-documentary style, follows police on the hunt for a resourceful criminal who shoots and kills a cop.

data.title: Niagara (1953)
data.summary: As two couples are visiting Niagara Falls, tensions between one wife and her husband reach the level of murder.

data.title: Stage Fright (1950)
data.summary: A struggling actress tries to help a friend prove his innocence when he's accused of murdering the husband of a high society entertainer.

data.title: I Walk Alone (1947)
data.summary: Frankie Madison leaves prison expecting a share from his ex-partner. But Prohibition bootlegging didn't prepare Frankie for Big Business.

data.title: The Glass Key (1942)
data.summary: A crooked politician finds himself being accused of murder by a gangster from whom he refused help during a re-election campaign.

data.title: While the City Sleeps (1956)
data.summary: A serial killer has been killing beautiful women in New York, and the new owner of a media company offers a high ranking job to the 1st administrator who can get the earliest scoops on the case.

data.title: The Hitch-Hiker (1953)
data.summary: Two fishermen pick up a psychotic escaped convict who tells them that he intends to murder them when the ride is over.

data.title: Moontide (1942)
data.summary: After a drunken binge on the San Pablo waterfront, longshoreman Bobo fears he may have killed a man. In his uncertainty, he takes a job on an isolated bait barge. That night, he rescues ...                See full summary »

data.title: The Unfaithful (1947)
data.summary: A Los Angeles socialite kills a man while home alone one night and claims he was an intruder she did not know. It seems like a clear case of self defense until the story hits the papers and people connected to the dead man come forward.

data.title: Don't Bother to Knock (1952)
data.summary: After being dumped by his girlfriend, an airline pilot pursues a babysitter in his hotel and gradually realizes she's dangerous.

data.title: Desperate (1947)
data.summary: A young married couple flee both police and a gangster out for revenge.

data.title: The Shanghai Gesture (1941)
data.summary: In Shanghai, dragon-lady 'Mother' Gin Sling operates a gambling house for wealthy patrons but she clashes with influential land developer Sir Guy Charteris who wants to put her out-of-business.

data.title: The Long Night (1947)
data.summary: Police surround the apartment of apparent murderer Joe Adams, who refuses to surrender although escape appears impossible. During the siege, Joe reflects on the circumstances that led him to this situation.

data.title: The Bribe (1949)
data.summary: Federal agent Rigby, in Central America to trace stolen plane engines, falls for the gorgeous wife of the chief suspect.

data.title: Killer's Kiss (1955)
data.summary: Ready to catch a train to his hometown, a washed up boxer tells us about the strange and twisty events that happened to him the past couple of days.

data.title: Cloak and Dagger (1946)
data.summary: In WW2, the Allies race against time to persuade two nuclear scientists working for the Germans to switch sides.

data.title: Thunder Road (1958)
data.summary: A veteran comes home from the Korean War to the mountains and takes over the family moonshining business. He has to battle big-city gangsters who are trying to take over the business and the police who are trying to put him in prison.

data.title: Journey Into Fear (1943)
data.summary: An American ballistics expert in Turkey finds himself targeted by Nazi agents. Safe passage home by ship is arranged for him, but he soon discovers that his pursuers are also on board.

data.title: Zero Hour! (1957)
data.summary: In 1950s Canada, during a commercial flight, the pilots and some passengers suffer food poisoning, thus forcing an ex-WW2 fighter pilot to try to land the airliner in heavy fog.

data.title: Lady in the Lake (1946)
data.summary: The lady editor of a crime magazine hires Philip Marlowe to find the wife of her boss. The private detective soon finds himself involved in murder.

data.title: The Las Vegas Story (1952)
data.summary: The arrival in Las Vegas of a businessman and his glamorous wife creates a complex web of murder and deceit.

data.title: Fingers at the Window (1942)
data.summary: The City of Chicago is gripped by an Axe Murderer. The streets are empty at night as there have been six murders and six people have been caught, but they are lunatics. Only one person has ...                See full summary »

data.title: Dangerous Mission (1954)
data.summary: A policeman tries to protect a young woman against a hit man, when she flees New York after witnessing a mob killing.
